title: Comeaux's Inc. Recalls Pork Products Due To Possible Listeria Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5, 2016 – Comeaux’s Inc., a Breaux Bridge, La. establishment, is recalling approximately 14 pounds of pork products that may be adulterated with Listeria monocytogenes, the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The smoked pork tasso was...
impacted_products: •1-lb. vacuum-sealed packages containing diced “CAJUN HICKORY SMOKED PORK TASSO.”
